name: Important Programming Notes
info:
Updated on 12/1/2023
To store a memory in NodeRED use global memory to store the value, so that we can call the memory elsewhere within the project.

Function 
to retrieve the memory use: example-
global.get(var1)

to set the global memory use: example-
global.set(var1,msg.payload);

name: Clock Toolbar
format:
<script id="titleScript" type="text/javascript">

$(function() {
    if($('.md-toolbar-tools').length != 0){
        loadClock();
    }else setTimeout(loadClock, 500)
});

function loadClock(){
    $('#clock').remove();
    var toolbar = $('.md-toolbar-tools');
    
    var div = $('<div/>');
    var p = $('<p/ id="clock">');
    
    div.append(p);
    div[0].style.margin = '5px 5px 5px auto';
    toolbar.append(div);

    function displayTitle(lh) {
        p.text(lh); 
    }
    
    function upTime() {
        var d = new Date();
        p.text(d.toLocaleString());
    }

    if(document.clockInterval){ 
            clearInterval(document.clockInterval);
            document.clockInterval = null;
    }
        
    document.clockInterval = setInterval(upTime,1000);
}

</script>

name: Text Panel 1
format:
<style>

    #tex1 {
        font-weight:bolder;
        letter-spacing: 4px;
        fill: red;
    }
    
    #tex2 {
        font-weight:bolder;
        letter-spacing: 4px;
        fill: lime;
    }
    
    #tex3 {
        font-weight:bolder;
        letter-spacing: 4px;
        fill: aqua;
    }
    
    #tex4 {
        font-weight:bolder;
        letter-spacing: 4px;
        fill: white;
    }
    
    #tex5 {
        font-weight:bolder;
        letter-spacing: 4px;
        fill: yellow;
}
    
</style>


<svg>


<text id="tex1" x="10" y="10" > {{msg.payload.key1}} </text>
<text id="tex2" x="10" y="30" > {{msg.payload.key2}} </text>
<text id="tex3" x="10" y="50" > {{msg.payload.key3}} </text>
<text id="tex4" x="10" y="70" > {{msg.payload.key4}} </text>
<text id="tex5" x="10" y="90" > {{msg.payload.key5}} </text>


</svg>
